page.title: 17EATING OUT
page.content: Here in Jersey we are spoilt for the number and quality of good eating places. Most of the pubs offer meals at set times of the day and in our D block alone we can choose between Greek, Chinese, Italian, French or English restaurants. Sea food always features strongly on the menus, much of it caught by local fishermen. A typical meal in the evening might be:- Moules Mariniere (mussels in garlic, white wine, and cream): consomme : Steak (perhaps flambee'd at your table) with a selection of fresh vegetables, Jersey new potatoes are famous for their taste. Black Forest Gateau with cream is one of the most popular desserts. With wine and coffee a good quality meal for two costs about Â£25. Amongst local residents, eating out is one of the most enjoyed evening entertainments.
